title: `cfg(key = "value")` should not imply `cfg(key)`

milestone.title: AST Pipeline for libcore 1.49 Complete
milestone.description:
This targets multiple parts of libcore 1.49:

1. Macro expansion
2. Builtin macro declarations
3. Proper name resolution
4. Proper handling of import statements

body:
If there is any cfg item with a value for some key, then we consider cfg(key) to be true. This is wrong.

I tried this code with `-frust-cfg=key="value"`:

```rust
#[cfg(key)]
pub fn f() {}
```

I expected to see this happen: `f` is not compiled

Instead, this happened: `f` is compiled

[Godbolt with comparison to rustc](https://godbolt.org/#z:OYLghAFBqd5QCxAYwPYBMCmBRdBLAF1QCcAaPECAMzwBtMA7AQwFtMQByARg9KtQYEAysib0QXACx8BBAKoBnTAAUAHpwAMvAFYTStJg1DEArgoKkl9ZATwDKjdAGFUtEywZ7HAGTwNMAHLuAEaYxHoADqgKhHYMLm4ekdGxAr7%2BQSyh4VyWmNa2AkIETMQECe6euVaYNnHFpQTpgSFheuaNFUnVJWXNmdkSAJSWqCbEyOwcAKQATADM0wCsAELIVMAQANaYAJ5DywAi0xoAghEmwQDUVAw3EENX0wDsKy%2BHHCO0nEu8nhxaUioTgAJTMBCuCjGE0wTwWPFIBE0nxGWxASw0%2Bk4kj%2ByKBnF4ChAmKRAM%2BpDgsBgiBQqBYEToYXIlDQ9MZ4WIXAAbAAOTFYABueEmADU8JgAO4AeQijE4CJotAIYSJEGCeOCflKu3lvE1zGIuylwW0tVJCNZbEEUoYtB1ZNIWBYhmA4gd%2BGIZrwAswRIdmFUtRMyt15EE%2BTxtDwwWI2pcWDxBGIeBYupGVAMwAUYslMrl3F4/EEIjE7CkMkEihU6gdulm%2BhdIFM5n00aJkBGqAihQYfoAtH31sBpvNDjtdiPjksnHNZgKxCZMMsZ7NZoT8l77BBHF0qqQfH4Wlk2rkojEe7vkue4v1Wjk8gV6r1yq5Ku0N3Uis/b8f7x0ypePSND%2BgxcCMULjJMwxYhwvykP8gLAhwVzNgQyBXFwAB0vKYRoVwQLghAkHC8xgbwpJaEMqLopi3wcDipCphi8F4khhLEoiyIjJSNKsgy9BkBQEB8eyIDAMgyDEAofYKMwEQKAgqAWIKwqYDm0qyv8Cp0MqUmUOqDr6tqoZGYaxqmjYoaWowBA2naeJOi6bqAh6Xo%2Bn6gIBkGIYFmGyp0YCUYxnGGBTICSYpmmfCZtm4oafmCqyCW4jlkW8hKGoeK6LkBhGE24KtsE7YPEC3ZxP2VCoYOGyTuOk7LrO85uEu06zuuj5bjur7dPuDDoCBJ6kGeqTxN1e7DT2A1/h%2BPYNABY3vh1DBzU0h4DIN/4voke6bVN0EQTC0F0XBCG8EhVyqDyXJ9lykhXAA4k4TggkI%2BGPc9r3OuYYSPAR%2BBEMQJFkZxZJUaQCCYEwWDhCVdEMUxmKnfiHDsSSXHUcxdHzLiDpsSDlFfJwa4sbjBL4yipA%2BlJcQgJIQA%3D%3D)
